title: How to to reset my forgotten Windows 10 password?

forumNotes.author: Jimerrealy
forumNotes.content: I forgot my Windows 10 password, it's local admin account not MS account, is it possible to reset my windows 10 without reset disk?

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Google for 'sticky keys windows 10'

You can use a WinPE, Win Install or linux boot CD or USB.

forumNotes.author: Guest_AnonVendetta_*
forumNotes.content: Trinity Rescue Kit should work. I seriously doubt that the way passwords are stored in 10 (in the SAM file buried somewhere in C:\\Windows) have changed that much from previous Windows OSes. Windows password security is a joke.

forumNotes.author: augustk
forumNotes.content: Make a windows reset disk, then you can reset admin password of the computer. It's quite easy to do that

forumNotes.author: Jimerrealy
forumNotes.content:
> Make a windows reset disk, then you can reset admin password of the computer. It's quite easy to do that

How to create a reset disk? I need a tutorial because I'm a computer novice!

forumNotes.author: augustk
forumNotes.content:
> How to create a reset disk? I need a tutorial because I'm a computer novice!

You can make a bootable reset disk either with USB or DVD. It depends on you. However, USB is preferred because of its portability. Here is the tutorial on how to create a reset disk and reset admin password: [http://www.iseepassw...0-password.html](http://www.iseepassword.com/reset-windows-10-password.html "External link")

forumNotes.author: Rusama
forumNotes.content:
iseepassword is not free.The sticky keys trick works flawlessly with almost all versions of Windows. There are also many free password tools such as Offline NT Password \& Registry Editor, PEPassPass, Ophcrack, etc.

[http://reboot.pro/to...198-pepasspass/](http://reboot.pro/topic/20198-pepasspass/ "")

[http://www.top-passw...reset-disk.html](http://www.top-password.com/knowledge/reset-windows-10-password-without-reset-disk.html "External link")

[http://www.chntpw.com/download/](http://www.chntpw.com/download/ "External link")

No need to pay a buck!

forumNotes.author: erwan.l
forumNotes.content:
Lets not confuse software performing bruteforce versus software performing offline reseting password.

The op was asking for a software reseting the password.

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> Lets not confuse software performing bruteforce versus software performing offline reseting password.
>
> The op was asking for a software reseting the password.

And let's not confuse those with software that allow *bypassing* the password ... (PassPass and similar/derivative PEPassPass do not bruteforce nor reset password, though once you have bypassed it you can reset it of course)

Sure, it originated *a long time ago in a galaxy far, far away,* you know like here :wink::

[http://reboot.pro/to...045-pepasspass/](http://reboot.pro/topic/20045-pepasspass/ "")

[http://reboot.pro/to...198-pepasspass/](http://reboot.pro/topic/20198-pepasspass/ "")

And before you think of creating it ![:w00t:](https://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/w00t.gif), also a PassPassLive exists, JFYI (only a POC with very little practical uses):

[http://reboot.pro/to...9-passpasslive/](http://reboot.pro/topic/19499-passpasslive/ "")

Of course, given that - at least for 64 bit - the patching is "specific" to each particular version and that the good MS guys release a queerly titled Windows version/update very often, since noone maintains (let alone properly) a list of patches (that could in theory well be independent from the "patching engine used BTW), it is very likely that none will be of actual use for a windows 10 system, particularly a "current" one ![:(](https://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/sad.png).

![:duff:](https://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/duff.gif)

Wonko

forumNotes.author: slore
forumNotes.content:
you can reset any Windows password that without any 3rd-party password uitlity, just need a Windows ISO(or PE).

boot with Windows ISO, press SHIFT+F10 to open a prompt(cmd window).

backup osk.exe-\>osk.exe.org and copy cmd.exe-\>osk.exe

```
X:>cd /d C:\Windows\System32
C:\Windows\System32>ren osk.exe osk.exe.org
C:\Windows\System32>copy cmd.exe osk.exe
```

now, colse the setup.exe windows for rebooting and remove the DVD(or USB).

in the host windows login UI, click "screen keyboard", now you startup a CMD with SYSTEM privilege,

just input \`**net user Adminstrator your_new_p@ssword** \` for reseting it. :smile:

Edited:

Oh, after logining with new password, rename the osk.exe.org back to osk.exe.

**Edited by slore, 15 November 2017 - 12:06 AM.**

forumNotes.author: erwan.l
forumNotes.content:
> you can reset any Windows password that without any 3rd-party password uitlity, just need a Windows ISO(or PE).
>
> boot with Windows ISO, press SHIFT+F10 to open a prompt(cmd window).
>
> backup osk.exe-\>osk.exe.org and copy cmd.exe-\>osk.exe
>
> ```
> X:>cd /d C:\Windows\System32
> C:\Windows\System32>ren osk.exe osk.exe.org
> C:\Windows\System32>copy cmd.exe osk.exe
> ```
>
> now, colse the setup.exe windows for rebooting and remove the DVD(or USB).
>
> in the host windows login UI, click "screen keyboard", now you startup a CMD with SYSTEM privilege,
>
> just input \`**net user Adminstrator your_new_p@ssword** \` for reseting it. :smile:
>
> Edited:
>
> Oh, after logining with new password, rename the osk.exe.org back to osk.exe.

Indeed, similar to the utilman.exe [trick](https://4sysops.com/archives/reset-a-windows-10-password/ "External link").

We have so far listed 3 different approaches with pros and cons:

-reset it : will not modify your system files, will not leave the password untouched, is rather quick

-bypass it : will temporarily modify your system files, will leave the password untouched, is rather quick

-bruteforce it : will not modify your system files, will leave the password untouched, needs lot of time

So far, for non hacking purposes, i.e reset a forgotten password, my preference goes to "reset it" : boot to winpe, reset password, reboot and log in your windows. 1 minute task (provided you have a winpe ready) ...
